How about the ultimate in artifact quests, an epic journey
for answers as millenia-old as Norrath herself that you
can immerse yourself in completely?

Then sit back, get comfortable, and make the pilgrimage
to see the Oracle of K'Arnon in the Ocean of Tears. Once
thought only good for dropping baby blue robes and
making paladin books, it now appears that the Oracle's
original quest has had some patches and is gearing up
to be one of the most massive quests the world has ever
seen, potentially resulting in (keep your fingers crossed)
one of the most powerful artifact items in the game. This
is the quest that all devotees of lore and exploration have
been patiently holding out for.

To properly delve into this monumental mission, a quick brush-up of your
                             world history is a must, but I shall attempt to highlight
                             most of it here for your benefit.  The Oracle of K'Arnon
                             is from a race almost as old as the planet herself, called
                             the Elddars.  Once a thriving and harmonious race,
                             these forebears of all elven races currently in existance
                             used to inhabit Elddar Forest (now the Desert of Ro) on
                             the original continent of Tunaria (Antonica). Before the
                             War of the Broken Crown, which split the Elddars into
                             the 3 current elven factions, the center of activity for
                             this race was the city of Takish-Hiz, which has long-
                             since sunken beneath the timeless sands of Ro (though
remenants of the city can still be seen rising up from some places in the sand). But eventually war did come to the Elddars and their ruler Emperor Kel'anthinstion -- not from their nemeses the Erudites, but from forces within their own race -- resulting in the obliteration of the capital city of Caerthiel and scattering the loyalists (dark elves), rebels (high elves), and wilds (wood elves) to various corners of the globe.

As was the Tome of Ages born to and nutured by the unified Elddar tribe many centuries before the war, so did their final conflict and splintering result in its destruction. Wanting to keep the Tome's eternal knowledge from the rebels' grasp, the Scribes of Dal made haste to break its 7 volumes into pieces, and entrusted the pieces to loyal scouts to disperse throughout the land, never to be made whole again.

Now enter the Oracle of K'Arnon, charged by the rebel leadership with the duty to seek the legendary Tome. Though the world we live in now is almost completely unrecognizable from his own world when his mission was set in stone for him, he and his guardian search ever onward, gleaning what bits of knowledge and hints of information as to the whereabouts of the scattered books that they can. A great and powerful artifact reward he would grant, for those who would aid him in his quest.

A transcript is provided below, so that you may see the whole of what he has to say when an adventurer first begins the quest (it should be noted that the books he says he does not seek,  are merely ones he will not talk to you about, until  you have given him the ones he WILL talk to you about). Your duty is to gather pieces of books and present them to a binder to make into whole volumes again, then deliver the volumes to the Oracle himself.  Intermediary rewards and additional hints are given as each new volume is presented to him; upon completion of the seventh and final volume, the intermediary rewards are presented back to the Oracle, presumably, and the victor is rewarded with the artifact promised. I say presumably, because many fans of lore theorize that not all books are yet available in the game, one prime example being a volume that is somehow tied to the as-yet unenterable Plane of Underfoot. However, it was disclosed that only recently a third or fourth volume in the series was made obtainable, and the search for knowledge has gained new drive as players seek out clues to the existance of the remaining ones. For more player comments on this quest, visit Allakhazam or EQ Maps to see what others have discovered. For histories of Norrath, Seekers of Lore have text reprints, and Allakhazam also provides further information in their Game Lore section.

[Thu Jun 07 10:49:16 2001] You say, 'Hail Guardian of K`Arnon'
[Thu Jun 07 10:49:16 2001] Guardian of K`Arnon says 'Harm the oracle and die.  I have nothing else to say.
[Thu Jun 07 11:07:11 2001] Guardian of K`Arnon regards you indifferently -- You could probably win this fight.
[Thu Jun 07 14:10:25 2001] You say, 'Hail Oracle of K`Arnon'
[Thu Jun 07 14:10:25 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'Greetings, Anasari , I am the Oracle of K'Arnon.  Do you quest for [knowledge] yourself, or do you offer that which I [seek]?
[Thu Jun 07 14:10:36 2001] You say, 'I quest for knowledge'
[Thu Jun 07 14:10:36 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'I have lived long and have insight into many matters, yet I despise charity.  To learn from me, you must first bring me that which I [seek].
[Thu Jun 07 14:10:49 2001] You say, 'What do you seek?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:10:49 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'I seek knowledge, which is superior to all things.  And no knowledge is greater than that which is contained within the [Tome of Ages].
[Thu Jun 07 14:11:09 2001] You say, 'What is the Tome of Ages?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:11:09 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'The Tome of Ages has been compiled over the millennia by the Scribes of [Dal].  It was divided into seven distinct books by the scribes to keep the knowledge from one such as me.  That said, with aid, I shall unite these books and the Tome of Ages shall be mine.
[Thu Jun 07 14:12:15 2001] You say, 'Who are the Dal'
[Thu Jun 07 14:12:15 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'They were elves once, but now are Teir'Dal, and as evil as they are wise.  Many tomes have they written, but none greater than the Tome of Ages.
[Thu Jun 07 14:13:02 2001] You say, 'What books?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:13:02 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'The seven Books that make up the Tome of Ages are those of Enlightenment, Scale, Turmoil,  Monuments, Elders, Blood, and the Lost Book.  Each of these great books is an important chapter in the history of Norrath.  If ever you find one of these books, bring it to me.
[Thu Jun 07 14:13:22 2001] You say, 'What Book of Turmoil?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:13:22 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'Ah, yes!  The Book of Turmoil.  I seek this book, and should you find it and return it to me, I will reward you with secret knowledge.
[Thu Jun 07 14:13:34 2001] You say, 'What Book of Scale?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:13:34 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'Ah, the Book of Scale.. It would be wondrous indeed if you could recover the Book of Scale for me.  If you do manage to procure the Book of Scale, I will gladly part with an artifact of my own that may be of interest to you.
[Thu Jun 07 14:14:34 2001] You say, 'What Book of Enlightenment?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:14:35 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'I do not seek the Book of Enlightenment at this time, but I might have need of it in the future.
[Thu Jun 07 14:14:40 2001] You say, 'What Lost Book?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:14:40 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'I do not seek the Lost Book at this time, but I might have need of it in the future.
[Thu Jun 07 14:14:59 2001] You say, 'What Book of Blood?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:14:59 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'I do not seek the Book of Blood at this time, but I might have need of it in the future.
[Thu Jun 07 14:15:11 2001] You say, 'What Book of Monuments?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:15:11 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'I do not seek the Book of Monuments at this time, but I might have need of it in the future.
[Thu Jun 07 14:15:13 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon begins to cast a spell.
[Thu Jun 07 14:15:16 2001] You say, 'What Book of Elders?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:15:16 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'I do not seek the Book of Elders at this time, but I might have need of it in the future.
[Thu Jun 07 14:15:17 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon begins to radiate.
[Thu Jun 07 14:15:21 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon begins to cast a spell.
[Thu Jun 07 14:15:24 2001] You say, 'Who is Marud?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:15:25 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon says 'Marud!  He is an imposter, an oracle of no worth.  The upstart Erudites are jealous of the Elddar and the knowledge we possess.
[Thu Jun 07 14:15:25 2001] Guardian of K`Arnon begins to radiate.
[Thu Jun 07 14:15:32 2001] You say, 'What Erudites?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:15:36 2001] You say, 'What is an Elddar?'
[Thu Jun 07 14:20:32 2001] Oracle of K`Arnon regards you indifferently -- You could probably win this fight.

The Tome of Ages
